title: Direct mayoral elections in Paris, Lyon, Marseille get green light from France's top court
subhead: The voting system in France's three largest cities will change in 2026, allowing voters to cast their ballots directly for central city councilors. The change could benefit right-wing mayoral hopeful Rachida Dati.

title: Trumpism: A political phenomenon that defies all definition
subhead: Techno-libertarian, isolationist fascist, plutocratic populist? The politics of the 47th US president are impossible to pin down. While some compare his approach to certain European regimes, others argue it should be understood strictly within an American context – even if that means inventing a new term.

title: Life with a disfigured face: 'You never get used to others' stares, you just live with it'
subhead: Whether due to an accident or illness, a major facial alteration can profoundly disrupt one's sense of identity. People who have been disfigured describe the painful processes of reclaiming their lives.

title: Wildfires blaze in southern France: 'It looked like the apocalypse'

title: In rural France, young people keep the local tradition of partying alive
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (1/6). In eastern Rignieu-le-Désert, the Amicale Des Jeunes youth association upholds the tradition of local balls, a custom that in some places is now seen as a way of preserving local identity.
